message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: Here's a more efficient way to divide a list into smaller lists of size n:

List<List<Comparable>> dividedLists = new ArrayList<>();
int size = A.size();
for (int i = 0; i < size; i += n) {
    List<Comparable> sublist = A.subList(i, Math.min(i + n, size));
    dividedLists.add(sublist);
    // perform operation on sublist
}
<<<explanation>>>: Instead of creating a new ArrayList for each sublist, you can use the subList method of the original list to create a view of the desired sublist. This avoids creating unnecessary copies of the elements. The Math.min function is used to handle the case where the last sublist may have fewer than n elements.
